In this spatial context—proximity to major shipping lanes such as HVDC SwePol and Carl Gustafs kyrka—it is common for such vessels to follow gently curving routes when departing anchorage, aligning with established maritime pathways that guide traffic through potentially congested or environmentally sensitive waters.
